release v0.4.0:
- include fingerprints of signatures in result and compare only those
- pubkey_attachment returns default key if no key specified
- key_ids option for find_gnupg_key
- backwards incompatible changes:
- * the default for 'strict' is now False
- * find_gnupg_key returns fingerprints by default

- create_mail has new BCC and charset parameters
- full support for unicode and other charsets
- backwards incompatible change: ending renamed to linesep in protect_mail
- use policies for Python3 and improved Python3 support
- more coverage
- KryptoMIME moved to core
- store tests keys as text

- valid key ids may be explicitly specified for verify and decrypt
 - recipient key ids may be explicitly specified for encrypt
 - initial experimental S/MIME support via OpenSSL

update requirements and use pip and setup test
add pytest.ini and .coveragerc
make source utf8 encoded
merge redundant code in verify/decrypt and sign/encrypt

pgp: multiple passphrase for decrypt/verify, dont check for receiver keys
